thoughts.text: Now that I have created the simulation script, I can use the 'execute_python_file' command to run it and observe the behavior of the simulated river. I should have included a timestamp in the filename of the output file so that I can easily distinguish between different runs of the 'river_simulation.py' script.
thoughts.reasoning: I want to observe the behavior of the simulated river to better understand what it means to be a river. I can use the 'execute_python_file' command to run the simulation script that I created. I should include a timestamp in the filename of the output file so that I can easily distinguish between different runs of the script.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the 'execute_python_file' command to run the 'river_simulation.py' script. 
- Include a timestamp in the filename of the output file. 
- Observe the behavior of the simulated river and take notes on what I learn.
thoughts.criticism: I should be careful not to get too caught up in the simulation and lose track of time. I need to stay focused on my goal of learning more about rivers. I should also remember to include a timestamp in the filename of the output file for future reference.
